newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Intuit trades lower.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Intuit trades lower.

text.p: Intuit Inc shares were expected to open Friday's market with a decline in reaction to the company's fiscal second quarter results announced after yesterday's market close, traders said.

The personal-finance software company said it earned $2.44 per share in the period ended January 31, after a gain of $1.50 per share from the sale of discontinued operations, versus $0.46 per share one year ago, including a charge of $0.04 per share.
Before the open, Intuit traded at 24, off 1-3/8, though volume was light.

Also, in a conference call with analysts and reporters detailing the company's performance, Intuit said revenue growth in the second half of fiscal 1997 will be slower than previously expected due to continued softness in consumer software products.
Elsewhere, 3Com Corp shares fell 3/4 to 34-1/4 while its merger partner U.S. Robotics declined one to 58-1/4.
Citrix Systems Inc bounced slightly higher before the market open, rising 3/4 to 11-3/8 after plummeting 15-5/8 points yesterday.

Collective Bancorp shares were unmoved after it said this morning it agreed to be acquired by Summit Bancorp . Terms of the deal call for Collective shareholders to receive 0.895 shares of Summit for each Collective share.
Based on Thursday's closing stock prices, the terms value Collective at $42.62 per share, $0.62 above Collective's Thursday Nasdaq close.
